statements: UPDATE MedicationUsage SET dosage = 2.5, adherence_rating = 4 WHERE patient_id = 101 AND medication_name = 'Cough Syrup'
UPDATE MedicationUsage SET adherence_rating = 5, dosage = 3.0 WHERE medication_name = 'Painkiller' AND usage_date = '2022-05-10'
UPDATE MedicationUsage SET dosage = 2.5, adherence_rating = 4 WHERE patient_id = 101 AND medication_name = 'Aspirin'
UPDATE MedicationUsage SET adherence_rating = 5, dosage = 3.0 WHERE medication_name = 'Tylenol' AND patient_id = 102
UPDATE Patients SET age=30, diagnosis='Common Cold' WHERE patient_id=101;
UPDATE Medications SET frequency='Twice a day', dosage='200mg' WHERE medication_id=201;
UPDATE Patients SET age = 30, diagnosis = 'Flu' WHERE patient_id = 101
UPDATE Medications SET frequency = 'Twice a day', dosage = '10mg' WHERE medication_id = 201
UPDATE medication_history SET dosage = 50 WHERE patient_id = 101
UPDATE adherence_data SET feedback = 'Positive feedback received' WHERE patient_id = 201
UPDATE medication_history SET dosage = 50 WHERE patient_id = 123 AND medication_name = 'Aspirin';
UPDATE adherence_data SET feedback = 'Patient reported feeling better' WHERE patient_id = 456 AND adherence_status = 'Good' AND medication_name = 'Ibuprofen';
UPDATE patients SET age = 30 WHERE name = 'Alice';
UPDATE medications SET dosage = '2 tablets' WHERE medication_name = 'Medicine X';
UPDATE patients SET age = 25 WHERE patient_id = 1;
UPDATE medications SET dosage = '2 pills daily' WHERE medication_id = 3;
UPDATE patient SET age = 30, heart_condition = 'Hypertension' WHERE patient_id = 1;
UPDATE prescription SET prescribe_date = '2022-01-05', doctor = 'Dr. Smith' WHERE prescription_id = 3;
UPDATE patient SET age = 30, gender = 'Male' WHERE name = 'John Doe';
UPDATE medication_log SET dosage_taken = '2 pills', adherence_status = 'Complete' WHERE log_id = 101;
